result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Dewayne Harris Jr

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Matter is rescheduled due to the 14-day statutory time frames. Parties notified. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Dewayne Harris Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Anthony Dewayne Harris Jr.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Return on Doctor's report. Defendant is still in custody at the CJF, has not been transported to DHS. Defense to file a FORTHWITH order to get defendant transported. Court adjourns matter for a review hearing in Branch 11.
Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

No parties present in court.
Case was not scheduled before Branch 28 on today's date.
Case called on the case along with Case# 22CF01056 to clarify Court's order.

On May 25, 2022 as to Case# 22CF01069:
Court ordered defendant committed for treatment for incompetency.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  
Case# 22CF01069 was adjourned for return on doctor's report on 8/30/2022 in Branch 11.

On May 25, 2022 as to Case# 22CF01056:
Court adopted the findings of as to the competency hearing held on Case# 22CF01069.

Order of Commitment should have been prepared to include both cases.
Amended Order of Commitment for Treatment to be forwarded to the Court for Judge's signature.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency), signed, filed and disbursed.

Corrected Order, signed filed and disbursed.
PROPOSED Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)

Defendant Anthony Dewayne Harris in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Anthony Dewayne Harris in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Competency Hearing proceeded.  State does not challenge Dr. Jenna Niess report.  Defense does challenge Dr. Niess report.    Sworn for the State:  Dr. Niess.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.
After review of all evidence, report of Dr. Niess, and testimony of Dr. Niess, Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent.  

 Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  The sheriff shall arrange for transportation of the defendant to the treatment facility.  The defendant shall be given 44 days of credit for re commitment incarceration.   Court ordered case adjourned for return on doctor's report on 8/30/2022 at 1:30.
  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Competency hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Anthony Dewayne Harris not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Parties in court to review doctor's report with the parties.
State is not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.
Defense counsel advises Court that the defendant is contesting the findings of the doctor's report.

Court orders case adjourned for competency hearing in Branch 28.

Forensics confirmed availability of Dr. Niess for the competency hearing.

Clerk:  jms
from Jenna Niess, Psy.D., dated April 7, 2022 - received
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Anthony Dewayne Harris in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Anthony Dewayne Harris in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Dewayne Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.   Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.

Hearing will be held on Dacast:

Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
